attributes.comment:
Dear Sir/Madam: I am concerned about the proposed changes in the immigration
fees because many of the immigrants are refugees and have escaped the torture,
war and religious/political persecution in their countries of birth with little, if any,
personal belongings or wealth. Many have endured great hardships in immigrating
to the United States of America and due to language/cultural barriers must take
low paying positions when they arrive. I would rather see graduated fees based on
income. Certainly a professional with a good income could afford to pay the
proposed fees, however, a minimum wage earner would often find it very difficult to
do so. Refugee centers estimate that it could take up to a full month's wages to
meet the proposed fee requirements. That seems a very steep price to pay for
citizenship in our country-a country whose government was formed by immigrants
from many countries- and who did not pay to enter. Please reconsider the
proposed fee requirements and try to construct a more fair and equitable fee
schedule that will keep citizenship within the reach of the "little man and woman".
Thank your for taking time to listen to my views.
Sincerely, Lewellyne Blanchard

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Lewellyne C. Blanchard
